intro: Erigeron kazachstanicus, commonly known as the Kazakh fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical structure supports its role in pollination and ecological interactions within its native environment.
